conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the electric force experienced by the small ball S_1 at point M, we need to analyze the given information and use the principles of electrostatics and mechanics.
Points A and B each have a charge Q.
Point O is the midpoint of the line connecting A and B.
Points M and N are on the perpendicular bisector of AB and are at a distance of sqrt(2)L from O.
The electric potential at point M is given by the sum of the potentials due to charges at A and B.
The distance from M to A and B is sqrt(2)L.
The potential due to a single charge Q at a distance r is kQ/r.
The potential at M is varphi_M = sqrt(2)kQ/L.
Similarly, the potential at point N is varphi_N = sqrt(2)kQ/L.
The electric field at point M is the vector sum of the fields due to charges at A and B.
The electric field due to a single charge Q at a distance r is kQ/r^2.
The electric field at M due to A and B is E_M = kQ/L^2.
The electric force F on a charge Q in an electric field E is given by F = QE.
The electric force on S_1 at point M is F_M = kQ^2/L^2.
The magnitude of the electric force experienced by the small ball S_1 at point M is kQ^2/L^2.
